title: Did Apple become really big when the iPhone became popular? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, they were on their way with the massive success of the iPod - selling about 90 million a year for 4 years at about $150 each but when they managed to QUADRUPLE the take to about $600 for each iPhone sold which quickly reached the 100+ mm sold per year, then over 200+ mm a year, that’s when Apple hit the next plateau. Also important, hardly anyone ever manages to create a massive blockbuster and then upscale it to a replacement product (Moto could not find a replacement for the RZR and even Nintendo has had trouble with consecutive blockbusters …)
